extractions.description: This paper introduces Tree Cross Attention (TCA), a variant of Cross Attention designed for efficient inference by retrieving information from a logarithmic number of tokens. The authors also present ReTreever, an architecture leveraging TCA for token-efficient inference. They demonstrate the efficacy of TCA and ReTreever across several tasks, including classification and uncertainty regression, showing significant improvements in token efficiency compared to other models like Perceiver IO.

type.justification: The paper includes experiments and empirical evaluations to show the effectiveness of the proposed models.
type.quote: We show empirically that Tree Cross Attention (TCA) performs comparable to Cross Attention across various classification and uncertainty regression tasks while being significantly more token-efficient.

name.justification: The study focuses on enhancing machine learning models for efficient inference.
name.quote: With the rapid growth in applications of machine learning, an important objective is to make inference efficient both in terms of compute and memory.

name.justification: The primary focus is on making inference more efficient in terms of processing time and memory usage.
name.quote: In this work, we propose Tree Cross Attention (TCA) - a module based on Cross Attention that only retrieves information from a logarithmic O(log(N )) number of tokens for performing inference.

name.justification: The model is a primary contribution of the paper.
name.quote: We propose Tree Cross Attention (TCA), a replacement for Cross Attention that performs retrieval, scaling logarithmically O(log(N )) with the number of tokens.

name.justification: ReTreever leverages Tree Cross Attention for token-efficient inference, introduced in the paper.
name.quote: Leveraging TCA, we introduce ReTreever, a flexible architecture for token-efficient inference.
